pattern.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done
pattern.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
A general pattern began to emerge.
Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (=always develop in the same way).

changing patterns of behaviour among students

pattern.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a regularly repeated arrangement of shapes, colours, or lines on a surface, usually as decoration
pattern.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: a black and white striped pattern
pattern.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a regularly repeated arrangement of sounds or words
pattern.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: A sonnet has a fixed rhyming pattern.
pattern.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a thing, idea, or person that is an example to copy
pattern.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: The book set the pattern for over 40 similar historical romances.
pattern.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a shape used as a guide for making something, especially a thin piece of paper used when cutting material to make clothes
pattern.translation[0].definitions[5].de: a small piece of cloth, paper etc that shows what a larger piece will look like
